intro: Anthistiria flosculosa, commonly known as the small-flowered anthistiria, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Its botanical features include a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and a short blooming period during the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
